summary: This document is an email chain from March 2021 discussing the tagging of documents in the 'USvEpstein Relativity' database. The primary topic is the request to add a 'Not Epstein Related' tag to a specific batch of documents, and the clarification of the contents of two batches (Batch 003 - USAO-SDFL and Batch 004 - OPR Materials).

events.title: Email chain regarding Epstein database tagging
events.description: Email correspondence between individuals (names redacted) discussing the addition of a 'Not Epstein Related' tag to documents in the USvEpstein Relativity database and clarifying the contents of specific document batches.

keyFacts: The email chain discusses the 'USvEpstein Relativity' database, indicating ongoing document management related to the Epstein case.
A request is made to add a 'Not Epstein Related' tag to a specific batch of documents for review purposes.

Two batches are referenced: Batch 003 - USAO-SDFL (documents from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida) and Batch 004 - OPR Materials (emails from the Office of Professional Responsibility).
The correspondence involves individuals from 'USANYS' (U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York) and a contractor, but all personal names are redacted.
The document shows procedural aspects of how evidence and materials were organized and tagged during the investigation.
